column2: AR DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
1. What is the slow moving vehicle symbol?
2. If a vehicle is coming towards you at night with its high beams on, making it hard to see the road ahead, you should:
column4: look ahead towards the right edge of your lane.
column6: look ahead towards the left edge of your lane.
column8: look straight ahead towards the middle of the lane.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column4: The road ahead curves right, then left

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Side road entering from the left

column2: 5. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:

7. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
8. Your driving ability can be affected by:
9. To avoid hydroplaning you should:
column6: slow down when roads are wet.

column2: 10. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column8: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.

column2: 11. The sign in the picture:
column4: is displayed on the rear of slow moving vehicles.
column6: is found at most intersections and indicates that drivers must yield to other vehicles.
column8: is a Construction and Maintenance Traffic Control sign.

column2: 12. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column6: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column8: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.

column2: 13. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 14. When turning, drivers should:
column4: always move to the right lane.
column8: increase their speed to improve stability.

column2: 15. To drive defensively you should:
column4: always put one car length between you and the car ahead.
column6: keep your eyes moving to look for possible hazards.
column8: look only at the car in front of you while driving.

column2: 16. You are driving and you are feeling drowsy. You should:
column6: turn on the radio to keep you awake.
column8: find a safe place to stop for a break.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
18. This road sign means:
column4: Look both ways before crossing the intersection

column2: 19. Slowing down just to look at collisions or anything else out of ordinary:
20. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
21. At an intersection without stop or yield signs, you should:
column4: yield to the vehicle to your right.
column6: wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection.
column8: yield to the vehicle to your left.

column2: 22. What should you do if your rear wheels start to skid?
column4: Turn the steering wheel in the direction the vehicle is trying to go.
column6: If the vehicle has ABS, pump the pedal carefully.
column8: Steer left if your rear wheels slide right.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: A road joins from the left
column8: You must bear either right or left

column2: 24. Which of the following factors affect the absorption of alcohol?
25. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
